results.name: Number of compositions of n where each part after the first is either twice or half the prior part.
comment: All quotients of adjacent parts are either 1/2 or 2.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..5000 (first 1001 terms from Andrew Howroyd)
example: The a(1) =  1 through a(12) = 14 compositions (A = 10, B = 11, C = 12):
maple: b:= proc(n, i) option remember; `if`(n=0, 1, add(b(n-j, j), j=
mathematica: b[n_, i_] := b[n, i] = If[n == 0, 1, Sum[b[n - j, j], {j, If[i == 0, Range[n], Select[{2i, i/2}, IntegerQ[#] && # <= n &]]}]];
a /@ Range[0, 80] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, May 09 2021, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
program: (PARI) seq(n)={my(M=matid(n)); for(k=1, n, for(i=1, k-1, M[i, k] = if(i%2==0,M[i/2,k-i]) + if(i*3<=k, M[i*2,k-i]))); concat([1], sum(q=1, n, M[q, ]))} \\ _Andrew Howroyd_, Mar 13 2021
